intro: Bakerella clavata subsp. sechellensis, commonly known as the Seychelles bakerella, is a unique member of the Rubiaceae family native to the Seychelles archipelago. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with a distinctive tubular shape. The plant grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal or disturbed habitats. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, slightly hairy texture. Bakerella clavata subsp. sechellensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native environment.
